title: Bilayer lipid membrane as a model of photodynamic therapy processes in cancer cells

author: Irene Jimenez Munguia, National University of Science and Technology MISIS

segmentation: Good afternoon, I would like to thank the organizing committee for allowing me to present the research and title be layer lipid membrane as a model of photodynamic therapy processes in cancer cells.
I would like to make a short introduction about photodynamic therapy.
This is a phototherapy, normally applied to the skin cancer that involves.
Light em photosensitizers.
Compounds reacting with this light, capable to induce cell death.
These photosensitizers are administrated through non invasive procedures.
Andfor activated by light delivery to generate.
Reactive oxygen species on the surface membrane.
The for the dynamic therapy is based on the differences between the normal and the tumor cells that tumor cells experience a high income.
Oxidative stress related to an increasing of reactive oxygen species.
This high concentration provides a unique opportunity to kill tumor cells by exceeding the 3rd hole into the into the cell.
An excessive production of reactive oxygen oxygen species may damage cellular components like DNA proteins or lipids that are embedded in the membrane.
We propose are to study the photodynamic therapy in vitro by evaluating the efficiency of this photo.
Sensitizer compounds.
Under controlled conditions and as an alternative, use to the biological models.
In this study, the lipid membranes can be formed in a round hole in the septum of a two compartment Teflon cell.
By applying the Mueller rooting method, that means are the solution of lipid solution in a solvent.
Previously in our laboratory it was developed a method for measure changes in the boundary potential the surface potential.
Is the surface is measure in the electric solution.

Once we have a compound that interact with the membrane, the intermembrane field can be represented by the potential drop inside the hydrophobic region, and if the difference of the bone of the boundary potential in their code solution is 0.
The boundary potential in each side of the membrane will generate an electric field.
This field will make a compression of the membrane, so the thickness of the membrane will decrease and then the capacitance will increase and this allows us to monitor during the experiments.
The voltage applied in the system will be equal to the difference of the boundary potential.
